questions.questionText: What is the most popular coding language of 2022?
questions.explanation: While it is pretty close at the top, Python is already used by 80% of programmers and that statistic is growing.

questions.questionText: Which of the below descriptions best describes machine learning?
questions.correctAnswer: Machine learning is a subfield of artificial intelligence, which is broadly defined as the capability of a machine to imitate intelligent human behavior.
options: Machine learning is a programming language that is used along with python to create android games.
Machine learning is a way for computer scientists to create robots.
Machine learning is a subfield of artificial intelligence, which is broadly defined as the capability of a machine to imitate intelligent human behavior.
questions.explanation: Machine learning is a part of AI and is a part of the goal to make machines copy human behavior.

questions.questionText: The goal of AI is to create computer models that exhibit “intelligent behaviors” like humans.
questions.explanation: The final goal of AI is to be able to teach robots the way of human learning so that they can learn for themselves and can almost act like humans.

questions.questionText: Which logo is similar to the python logo?
questions.explanation: The python logo is similar to an s that has 2 snakes as the curves. The second one is the exact logo.

questions.questionText: What coding language is C++ based on and an extension of?
questions.explanation: C++ was based off of C as an extension that would preform similarly to C but would be able to use OOP.

questions.questionText: How many coding languages are there?
questions.explanation: Incredibly, there are in fact more than 700 different programming languages in the world. That is actually more that how many seaking languages there are.

questions.questionText: Where did the term coding bugs come from?
questions.correctAnswer: There was a Harvard student who found out that the thing causing his computer to malfunction was a moth in the relay.
options: There was a professor in MIT who thought of the term when a fly kept bothering him while he was fixing code errors.
There was a Harvard student who found out that the thing causing his computer to malfunction was a moth in the relay.
Neither of these is the correct reason why.
questions.explanation: There was a day when a Harvard admin was trying to figure out why some of his computers weren't working correctly and when he opened the main machine up, he saw that there was a moth that had found a way in.

questions.questionText: The first programmer was the son of a mad poet.
questions.explanation: Rather than a son, it was actually the daughter of a mad poet who is considered one of the creators of modern programming theory.

questions.questionText: Which acronym represents artificial intelligence?
questions.explanation: Artificial Intelligence is most commonly referred to as AI when trying to speak about it in passing.

questions.questionText: What is the word that describes code based on either zeroes or ones.
questions.explanation: The answer is binary since there is only 2 possible numbers, hence the bi in binary.

questions.questionText: What is the name of the language that was named after a famous French mathematician?
questions.explanation: Pascal was the famous french mathematician. Gauss and Euler were also pretty famous but both were not french either.

questions.questionText: Neural networks, also known as artificial neural networks (ANNs) or simulated neural networks (SNNs), are a subset of machine learning and are at the heart of deep learning algorithms. What part of the human body are they named after?
questions.explanation: Neural networks seek to copy how the human brian learns to see if that same way of learning can be copied in robots.

questions.questionText: The first computer used electricity.
questions.explanation: The first computer was not powered by electricity but was rather just a hand-worked machine.

questions.questionText: What logo is closest to representing the Atom editor?
questions.explanation: The atom logo looks like an atom (obviously) so it is clear that the first picture is the correct one.

questions.questionText: How old was the youngest coder ever?
questions.explanation: The youngest coder ever was 6 years old when he took the microsoft coding profisciency test and passed it.

questions.questionText: Where was the first virus created?
questions.explanation: The first virus was created in Pakistan as a harmless replicating virus that stated copyrights.

questions.questionText: There was a famous mathmetician named Alexander Turing who cracked the cipher the Nazis used in WW2. What was the cipher machine called?
questions.explanation: The enigma machine was a machine used by the Nazis very famous for how difficult it was to crack. It had a cycling key that changed daily so it was very difficult for Alexander Turing to finally crack it.

questions.questionText: The first computer game ever made zero profit for it's creators.
questions.explanation: The first computer game was created for fun and was left free so everyone could enjoy it.

questions.questionText: What type of language is Java?
questions.explanation: Java is an object oriented language which is why the correct answer is OOP.

questions.questionText: What type of hacker is the good kind? Black Hat or White Hat?
questions.explanation: There are many types of hackers but 2 of the main ones are Black Hat(who hack illegally) and White Hat(who hack to find vulnerabilities legally).
